ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 119
ygData.msgSnippet: I believe the warrior specific crafted armor can be resized by a couple of dwarves in West commons...
ygData.messageBody:
I believe the warrior specific crafted armor can be resized by a couple of
dwarves in West commons...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: EQ_SMITHS@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EQ_SMITHS@yahoogroups.com]
> Sent: Thursday, May 03, 2001 3:19 AM
> To: EQ_SMITHS@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Digest Number 119
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <matosvr@...>
> To: <EQ_SMITHS@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, May 01, 2001 1:24 PM
> Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Resizing
>
>
> > Anyone have any info on resizing armor and what you need to do this?
> > Will resizing work with Banded? Plate? Dyed Plate? Cultural? Ive
> > tried placing pieces of armor in a forge with a scaler to see what
> > happens and I get the message "These items do not combine...blah blah
> > blah" Ive also tried adding a flask of water and nothing.
> >
> > Arud Bastad
> > 41 Bard of Bristlebane
> >
> >
> >
> > The EQ BlackSmithy Discussion Group
> > List Administrator:
> > chade@...
> >
> > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
> http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
> >
> >
> >
>
>
>
> ________________________________________________________________________
> ________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Wed, 02 May 2001 20:57:10 -0000
> From: matosvr@...
> Subject: Re: Resizing
>
> Actually Ive seen a few smiths auction that they were resizing armor
> for a fee. I thought this was bogus so I asked them how. They
> remained tightlipped so I don't know if it was true or not. Nest time
> I find one I'm gonna give him some armor to see if they can really
> resize it.
>
> Arud Bastad
> 42 Bard on Bristlebane
>
> --- In EQ_SMITHS@y..., "Khelan" <khelan@a...> wrote:
> > You have to size the armor when you create (use large/small/medium
> molds
> > with the sheets of metal or anything else that's needed.) Once the
> armor is
> > created you cannot change it's size.
> >
> >
> > --Khelan Bard of 52 Songs lost somewhere on Tarew Marr.
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: <matosvr@t...>
> > To: <EQ_SMITHS@y...>
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 01, 2001 1:24 PM
> > Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Resizing
> >
> >
> > > Anyone have any info on resizing armor and what you need to do
> this?
> > > Will resizing work with Banded? Plate? Dyed Plate? Cultural? Ive
> > > tried placing pieces of armor in a forge with a scaler to see what
> > > happens and I get the message "These items do not combine...blah
> blah
> > > blah" Ive also tried adding a flask of water and nothing.
> > >
> > > Arud Bastad
> > > 41 Bard of Bristlebane
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > The EQ BlackSmithy Discussion Group
> > > List Administrator:
> > > chade@s...

> http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/

> Message: 3
> Date: Wed, 2 May 2001 18:58:19 -0500
> From: Charles Lembke <c-lembke@...>
> Subject: RE: Re: Resizing
>
> The only armor I've ever heard of being resized is crafted armor. Some
> quest to get small crafted (lighter maybe).
>
> I suspect that all he is really doing is selling you a different peice of
> armor. If he is doing it by the smithing skill, ask to group with him so
> you can see the success/fail message.
>
> Vulfgange
> 51 Warrior, 176 in smithing
>
